Job Title: Associate Principal Scientist, Data and Workflow - Pharmacokinetics

Location: West Point, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Job Description

Our company is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines, and animal health products. The difference between potential and achievement lies in the spark that fuels innovation and inventiveness; this is the space where our company has codified its legacy for over a century. Our success is backed by ethical integrity, forward momentum, and an inspiring mission to achieve new milestones in global healthcare. We are on the quest for cures and committed to be the world’s premier biopharmaceutical company. Our company's Research Laboratories is a true scientific research facility of tomorrow, applying our advanced discovery capabilities and world-class small molecule, biologics, vaccine R&D expertise to create breakthrough science that radically changes the way we approach serious diseases.

The Workflow and Data Capture (WDC) team of Pharmacokinetics, Dynamics, Metabolism, and Bioanalytical (PDMB) in our Research and Development Division is seeking a full time Data and Workflow Associate Principal Scientist to support ongoing and new efforts to optimize our data collection and use in inventing new medicines. PDMB partners in the discovery and development of candidate medicines suitable for clinical trials. The WDC team’s focus is streamlining our workflows by improving automation and scientific data capture, providing the foundation for our company's translational modeling, AI/ML and decision-making platforms. The successful candidate will work closely with scientists from across PDMB and beyond, building in-depth knowledge of the science, technology and workflows to identify and lead projects and/ or develop proof of concepts to drive improvements in the handling and application of data. They will also focus on further developing the integration of data and workflows with the broader Research and Development Division's organization establishing a broad network of scientific and IT partners.

The successful candidate will have a track record of technical project management and will be part of a collaborative cross disciplinary team working closely with other research functions and our IT colleagues. This role will be located at our West Point, PA, USA research site and may involve some travel and remote work. This role will collaborate closely with our scientists to understand and uncover needs in workflow and data capture, develop and execute upon strategy and spearhead the implementation of innovative solutions.

Qualifications

Required Education and Experience

Masters or Bachelor Degree in Life Sciences, Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent with 7 or more years of industrial experience

Responsibilities

Work collaboratively with data producers, consumers and partners across PDMB to enhance our data infrastructure.Effectively manage complex projects from conception through completion with a wide variety of stakeholders.Assist with troubleshooting and error recovery.Work with WDC team to prioritize highest reward projects and shape the group’s strategy.

Required Experience And Skills

Must be a self-starter, able to work in an entrepreneurial and independent way.Must be a team player with strong collaboration and communication skills.Experience leading complex projects with cross-functional teams.Experience in a lab-based setting, working with lab data capture systems and automation.

Preferred Experience And Skills

Laboratory process automation and instrument integration experience preferred.Knowledge of OEM instrument platforms typical of biology, biochemistry or chemistry laboratory workflowsExperience training end-users in new software systemsExperience with working with IT partners in industryExperience with change managementExperience across drug discovery and/or with regulated data and workflowsExperience prototyping new and enhanced systemsExperience with Cloud-based architecture (AWS, etc.)Experience with scripting/programing in one or more of the following: C#, python, javascript, R, R-shiny, Web developmentData engineering and database developmentAwareness of data harmonization initiatives, standardized ontologies and their application

Your role at our company is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At our company, we’re inventing for life.

NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS

In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.

If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.

Employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as customer-facing commercial, or research-based roles, will be expected to comply not only with Company policy but also with policies established by such external stakeholders (for example, a requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to access a facility or meet with stakeholders). Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. Please also note that, where permitted by applicable law, the Company reserves the right to require COVID-19 vaccinations for positions, such as in Global Employee Health, where the Company determines in its discretion that the nature of the role presents an increased risk of disease transmission.

U.S. Hybrid Work Model

Effective September 5, 2023, employees in office-based positions in the U.S. will be working a Hybrid work consisting of three total days on-site per week, generally Tuesday, Wednesday and either Monday or Thursday, although the specific days may vary by site or organization, with Friday designated as a remote-working day, unless business critical tasks require an on-site presence. This Hybrid work model does not apply to, and daily in-person attendance is required for, field-based positions; facility-based, manufacturing-based, or research-based positions where the work to be performed is located at a Company site; positions covered by a collective-bargaining agreement (unless the agreement provides for hybrid work); or any other position for which the Company has determined the job requirements cannot be reasonably met working remotely. Please note, this Hybrid work model guidance also does not apply to roles that have been designated as “remote”.
